text: The whole dysfunctional megalopolis, beige and blurry in summer smog. If this is the American Dream, do me a favor wake me up.
The traffic loop outside the terminals is gridlocked -- m with stretch limousines.

Inside, the airport is done up with festive posters, stre and banners: Welcome - Pacific Partners Summit A planeload of cheerful CHINESE DELEGATES come into the crowded terminal. Some sport red T-shirts with a picture Mao wearing Mickey Mouse ears. They get onto the people mover, passing by a TV REPORTER:
(to TV CAMERA)

Eager to mend its tarnished image, Los Angeles has really put out the welcome mat for tomorrow's summit. The city promises quite a party as leaders from Japan, China, South Korea, Australia, the U.S. and others begin talks for the largest free-trade treaty in history. The SCENE changes to TAPE of DELEGATES from other countri arriving. Then, we see massive SECURITY PREPARATIONS all around the
(continuing)

The one sour note is North Korea, the only Pacific Rim country not participating. There are rumors of secret meetings with North Korean representatives, but U.S. officials insist the North must first hold democratic elections, and halt its nuclear weapons program -- as they claimed to have done back in 1995. We CUT TO a heated debate in the UN SECURITY COUNCIL. Then ARTILLERY FIRE over the Korean DMZ. The SCENE returns to LAX.
(continuing)
Tensions remain high since last year's skirmishes between North Korea and the U.S. So any chance of the communist North joining the Pacific Partners seems highly unlikely.
An exclusive, walled-off section of Hancock Park. There's one route in and out, past a manned guardhouse on Wilshir
A Colonial-style mansion, surrounded by an imposing, wrou iron fence. There is a bronze plaque, in English and Kore next to the entranceway: Consulate of the
Democratic People's Republic of Korea The driveway gate opens and a long, black Mercedes with t windows and diplomatic license plates glides out.
An alert North Korean CORPORAL watches the perimeter MONI He pushes a switch to close the gate behind the Mercedes.
From atop a pole outside the south wall, a man with binoc overlooks the private streets of Fremont Place.
as the Mercedes cruises through the quiet neighborhood.

The man, PAUL JAVAL, is thirtyish, nervous; with short, s hair. He takes the binoculars away from his face and we s his eyes -- they're a strange, unnaturally light gray. Javal takes an ORANGE PILL from an unlabeled prescription bottle and pops it into his mouth. He climbs down the pol a van with a phone company logo on it.
The Mercedes comes out of the Fremont Place gate, and tur into the heavy morning traffic.

It is extremely quiet, due to inch-thick glass on the win and 4,000 pounds of armor plating on the car's chassis. The DRIVER is a North Korean Army Major. On the seat besi him is an AMD-74, a 5.45x39mm-caliber machine gun. A HAND from the back seat darts between the front seats a turns on the RADIO to a ROCK station. The Driver turns it
The hand belongs to 10-year-old SAM KE HAN. Sam sits back sighs to his sister, JOY (15). Between them sits a middle Scandinavian GOVERNESS.
I can't stand it -- half an hour to get to the stupid school every morning... with no music... (Korean; subtitled)
[Just our damn Nanny...]
Javal's van, also with tinted windows, turns onto Crensha follows the Mercedes, several cars behind it.
Javal, wired, drums on the steering wheel while driving. glances at some expertly constructed, radio-control REMOT UNITS sitting on the seat next to him.

Traffic is moving at about 35 MPH. The Mercedes merges on the freeway, heading west. Javal's van follows. The thumping of a RAP SONG rattles the other drivers' fil as a LOWRIDER with its stereo turned up to "11" cruises b
Even 500 watts of bass cannot penetrate the armored silen The Driver scans the road, wary but sensing no danger. He on his blinker to take the 405 South exit.
The van follows, now directly behind the Mercedes, in a procession of vehicles going up the long, curved overpass arcing 100 feet above the 10, toward the 405.
As they approach the crest of the overpass, Javal flips a switch on his radio-control unit...

Six small SEMICIRCLES, exact replicas of the stay-alert b on the white lines of the overpass, EXPLODE. They spew hu of sharp, triangular nails across the roadway. Immediatel scores of tires on passing cars BLOW OUT...

Causing, 50 yards ahead of the Mercedes and van, the most hellacious, gut-wrenching, piss-your-pants, chain-reactio PILE-UP you can imagine. Dozens of drivers LOSE CONTROL of their vehicles... sides their neighbors... grind against the guard rails. Some fishtail into 180's, smashing headlong into the traffic s coming onto the overpass. Brakes squeal, people scream, metal crumples, airbags dep glass shatters. And then it gets really nasty... A Honda gets jammed under a truck hauling cinder blocks. truck JACKKNIFES, tipping over like a drunken giant. It SMASHES through the concrete wall and guard rail... Along with several cars and their SCREAMING OCCUPANTS, sw over the edge by the truck like discarded soda cans. They plummet through space, CRASHING onto the freeway bel
Sam, Joy, and the Governess brace themselves as the Drive slams on the brakes. He barely avoids hitting anything.
(Korean)
[Stay in the car.]
A nightmare scene of smoke, twisted wrecks, dazed victims Mercedes and van sit motionless in the backed-up traffic.
Javal slides open a TRAP DOOR on the floor of the van. He slips a wheeled, mechanic's repair platform through it.

as, unnoticed amid the chaos, he lies on the platform and rolls under the Mercedes. The undercarriage of the Mercedes is armored with steel. stops at a patch of perforations -- an air exchange vent. attaches a slim DEVICE over the vent, flips a switch on i then rolls back toward the van.
Oblivious to Javal's actions below them, everyone watches police and news helicopters circle above. Then, some CHP motorcycles straddle the lanes and zoom by.
Sweating, Javal sits back in the driver's seat and checks another radio unit. Working.

The CHP has cleared a path through the devastation, and traffic trickles through. As the Mercedes and the van pas Javal looks proudly at the misery he's wrought. He follow Mercedes onto the 405 south.

Javal drives behind the Mercedes, with one hand on the ra unit. The Mercedes signals to take the Venice exit. Javal fingers the radio unit, itching to use it... But he PASSES by the Mercedes as it gets off the freeway.
Javal's device is armed, and waiting...

A pretty street in the Miracle Mile, lined with neat, sin family homes. Timed SPRINKLER systems water some of the y Every house on the block except the one we're in front of a "For Sale" sign on the lawn. From the weathered looks o signs, they've been there for quite a while.

It's a hot night. The ceiling fan above the bed spins slo PETE CARSON tosses restlessly in bed, the sheets half-cov him. Next to him his wife, MIRANDA KNOLL, snores contente Carson is in his late thirties, outdoorsy, with a tight, muscular build. Emotionally he's tightly-wound as well. Miranda is 35, raven-haired, sensible, pretty. She believ above all else that one should never raise one's voice. Carson groans... he's DREAMING...

Quick, SILENT IMAGES: A street cordoned off with police t Cops, SWAT teams, FBI surround BEVERLY THRIFT, a bank. Carson, younger, hair shorter, sits in an FBI COMMAND TRU across from the bank. Covering the mouthpiece of the phon his hand, he's arguing with the OTHER AGENTS in the truck Suddenly, a huge, fiery EXPLOSION blows out the front of bank building. Horrified, Carson runs toward it...
Carson is snapped awake by a CAR ALARM going off outside.
Son of a bitch! He bolts out of bed, wearing nothing but a pair of stripe bikini briefs. Miranda rolls over, sleepy, unconcerned...
Pete... please... we have to be up early tomorrow. Call the police.

Yeah, right. He races down the hall -- right past the house alarm keyp its LCD reading "ARMED." He grabs an aluminum baseball bat from the umbrella stand Forgetting to disarm the house alarm, he yanks the front open. The house alarm begins SHRIEKING.
(continuing)
Shit!
pulls the pillows over her head and sighs.
Not again...

Carson comes around to the driveway, which is illuminated the streetlight -- Where two 20-ish ASSHOLES are sitting in his 1965 Mustang convertible, their presence courtesy of a huge cut they'v made in the otherwise-perfect ragtop. Car-theft tools in a leather case between them, they're p the ignition switch out of the dashboard. Asshole #1 spots Carson. He gets out of the car, wielding crowbar. His partner keeps working.

Asshole #1 lunges viciously, swiping at Carson with the crowbar, taking a piece out of his side. Carson starts BLEEDING profusely, but he's too pissed to notice. Carson uses his bat to take the offensive. They go at eac other like combatants in a swordfight, the CLANKING of me echoing through the neighborhood along with the screaming house and car ALARMS, and frantic neighborhood DOGS. Surprised at Carson's fury and strength, Asshole #1 backs the lawn, oblivious to the running SPRINKLERS. As he backs away, his shoe catches on one of the sprinkle heads. It breaks off, and a huge GEYSER of water sprays o Carson holds his bat in both hands and jams the front of into Asshole #1's breadbasket. He doubles over. Carson grabs Asshole #1's arm, and pulls it quickly again his raised knee. There is a SNAP and a loud howl as the a breaks, and Carson tosses him aside. Seeing this, Asshole #2 gives up on the car. He takes off toward the street. Carson runs to head him off, but he's faster in his Air Jordans than Carson is in his bare feet

Carson grabs the metal lid from a garbage can at the curb FLINGS it like a huge Frisbee. It sails across the street And NAILS Asshole #2's head. He kisses the pavement, stun Carson runs up and grabs him, but he pulls out a long, sh screwdriver and jabs at Carson with it. Then, blue flashing lights appear from around the corner: WESTEC Chevy Blazer. Two uniformed GUARDS get out, and fu with their sidearms.
Everybody... chill! Bikini boy! On the ground! Asshole #2 is still trying to gouge Carson with the screwdriver. Carson glares at the dopey Guards.
Asshole was trying to boost my car!
Carson's fiftyish, black, next-door NEIGHBOR, wearing paj and a robe, comes out of his house. Carson sees him.
Mike -- call 911!
Been trying... (has a cordless phone)
It's busy. (to Guards; re Carson)
He's the good guy, you schumcks. The Guards seem to get it. Without warning, one takes out TASER and ZAPS Asshole #2. Carson lets go just in time.

Holding his bleeding side, Carson walks back to his house notices the "Neighborhood Watch" sign has graffiti spray- painted on it. He touches it -- the paint is still wet. H Neighbor shrugs -- whatta ya gonna do? The PAPER GUY drives by... and tosses Carson's newspaper under the gushing SPRINKLER.
I hate this fuckin' town.
Joy is standing on the toilet, blowing cigarette smoke in the exhaust fan. Someone KNOCKS on the door. She flicks t cigarette into the toilet, puts a ZIPPO LIGHTER in her po
Joy opens the bathroom door. Sam is standing there, grinn
There are six bathrooms in this house, Sam.
(fanning the air)
But only one with a smoking section. She quickly closes the door behind her. Sam laughs.

Sam and Joy sit at the table. AMBASSADOR HAN and MRS. HAN having breakfast: radish soup, kimchi and grilled fish. Ambassador Han reads through the morning's faxed communiq He's 43, rarely smiles, and hates living in the U.S. He's dressed in an impeccably-tailored, Valentino two-piece su Mrs. Han is slender, soft-spoken, but as iron-willed as h husband. She, however, is quick to smile. She's wearing a summery dress with a white sweater over her shoulders. Ambassador Han pulls the front of Sam's shirt to reveal t "Nirvana" logo on his T-shirt.
(Korean)
[Go change.] Ambassador Han's X-ray stare turns to Joy.
(continuing)
[You smell like a fireplace.] A BUTLER appears with a phone. He WHISPERS to Mrs. Han.
It's the Governess... (into phone)
Hello, Hilda...
as she speaks into a cellular phone. She's extremely nerv We cannot see her surroundings.
(thru phone)
Mrs. Han... I am very sick today...
(into phone)
We will see you next week... (hangs up; smiles to kids)
It appears I'll be taking you to school.
In the back of his van, Javal pats the Governess' hand.

Very good. You may go now... He speaks with a slight accent, French, perhaps. He pops orange pill, then unlatches the rear doors of the van. Wi quick glance back at him, she goes to open the doors. Javal grabs a plastic tarp and throws it over the Governe upper body. He puts his arm across her neck, flicks open gravity knife and PLUNGES it through the tarp, into her c He drops her on the floor of the van and fastidiously wip small smudge of blood from his hand with a handkerchief.

Carson steps out of the shower. He looks exhausted. Towel off, he goes into the bedroom, where Miranda is riding an exercise bike, listening to music on headphones and readi the sprinkler-soaked newspaper, all while watching the TV
A perky blonde traffic reporter, BOBBI MARCHFELDER, talks us from a local NEWS COPTER.
(on TV)

...Good morning, Summit Day! It's gonna be the Super Bowl, the 4th of July, the Olympics and Woodstock all rolled into one! All over town there'll be parades, concerts, rallies, festivals... So get out there everyone, but plan your drive- time accordingly! This is Bobbi Marchfelder, your Eye in the Sky... We CUT TO the White House lawn, where the PRESIDENT is ab to board a helicopter.
(on TV)
The President is on his way...
(on TV)
...It's an honor hosting my fellow leaders in Los Angeles, the capitol city of the Pacific Rim... We CUT BACK to the studio and the MORNING ANCHOR.
(on TV)
We'll see the menu for Mayor Simpson's Brentwood barbecue, right after this... We CUT TO a MUSICAL MONTAGE of preparations for the event around town.
As the MUSIC swells, Carson turns the TV off.
I was watching that.
If I hear one more Beach Boys song, I'll shoot myself. Miranda points at the headphones -- she can't hear him.
(continuing; while smiling)
I said, if we were having sex once in a while, you wouldn't need to ride that fucking bike every morning.
(hasn't heard a thing)

Be right with you... As Carson dresses, we get a LOOK at their bedroom -- Mira nightstand has two neat stacks of periodicals on it, with Angeles magazine and Psychology Today on the top of them. Carson's nightstand is overflowing with books and magazin about other cities and states: Wonderland Washington; Magnificent Oregon; Welcome to North Carolina."

Miranda, dressed in a conservative skirt, jacket, black s is out on the patio. Her breakfast -- a bowl of fruit and wheat germ -- sits on the patio table while she waters so sickly-looking ROSE BUSHES in a planter. Carson, dressed in shirt and tie, looking beat, fries a s and three eggs in butter. He comes outside with his break and a magazine article: "American Expatriates in New Zeal
(looks him over)
Have you gotten any sleep lately?
(ignores the question)
Shop's gonna tow the car in -- goddamn ignition's trashed.
Take mine. I'll ride in with Diane. Carson watches as she carefully picks the dead leaves off rose bushes.
You ask me, those suckers are a lost cause. She continues, then glances at the article Carson is read
It's not for you.
You mean it's not for you.
I don't chase car thieves in my underwear. C'mon, you'd die of boredom if we ever sold this house and moved.
I'd die of shock, from finding anyone dumb enough to buy the place. Even for what it's worth now.
Lots of people bought at the top of the market...
That sure cheers me right up.

I don't know why we even talk about it. The city's not the problem. So we move. It wouldn't matter. What's that saying: "Wherever you go, there you are." Carson just looks at her. Reaching for the salt, he wince from the cut in his side.
(continuing)
I hope you're current on your tetanus booster. Was it worth it?
One cut... two assholes in the hospital... Yep. Carson glances at his watch and gets up.
(continuing)

Well, another day of baby-sitting my favorite bunch of people... He grabs a Bianchi shoulder holster with a Sig-Sauer P-22 9mm pistol, straps it on, then pulls on a blue windbreake Emblazoned on the back are large yellow letters: FBI.
Ask for a transfer.
They're not gonna transfer me. You know damn well why I was bumped down to guard duty... (as he's leaving)
My outstanding people skills. Miranda tries to return to tending her roses. But instead sadly watches him go.

A look of sorrow crosses Carson's face as he watches some YOUNG KIDS laugh and shove, getting onto a school bus. He then glances at his wounded Mustang, parked in the str He spots something on the windshield: A pink parking tick The parking sign above the graffiti-stained Neighborhood sign reads: Street Cleaning - Friday 8-10 AM.

I hate this fuckin' town. Carson CHIRPS open Miranda's car: a red Volvo 960. As he pulls away, we SEE a bumper sticker on the car: a c and slash through cartoon weapons on one side, cartoon te bears on the other, and "Arms Are For Hugging" in between
The Driver backs the Mercedes out of the garage behind th Consulate. We notice there is ANOTHER MERCEDES parked ins Mrs. Han, Sam and Joy come outside. They hear some heartf
Goddamn Limey overpriced piece a shit...

In the driveway across the street, a man in a business su has his head under the hood of a brand-new Jaguar convert The JAG OWNER's 15-year-old, blonde daughter, LISA, sits the car with her schoolbooks in her lap.
turns to Mrs. Han:
Can we give Lisa a ride?
It pulls into the driveway across the street. The Jag Own still SWEARING mightily. Lisa climbs into the Mercedes.
Hey, Joy... Sam... Joy rolls the window up and the SOUND of cursing disappea
(continuing)
Excellent -- I can't hear him!
(raps on window)
The glass is an inch thick. (points to doors, roof)
Armor-plated. Bulletproof. Bomb- proof.
Perfect car for L.A. (looks back at her Dad)
Starts, too.
As the Mercedes travels its usual route down Crenshaw, Ja van begins following it.
where Javal's DEVICE is attached, still waiting...

A dark-green government Dodge pulls up and parks behind o just like it on a paved area near the Consulate gate. DAVE JUAREZ, (chubby, 40, Mexican-American, a desk jockey out of the Dodge and hangs an FBI shield over his top poc He glances over at North Korean Security Chief COLONEL LE (45), who has paused inside the gate to regard Dave, and outside world, with profound contempt. Dave, attachE case in one hand and notebook computer in t other, walks to a 10-by-15 detached guardhouse on the far corner of the property, just outside the high fence.

Inside are two desks and four chairs, a console of communication equipment, a microwave and a Mr. Coffee. Dave enters. Two FBI agents, finishing their shift, gathe their belongings: ROBBINS (late 20's; male; thinning hair SABATINI, (early 30's; cute; dark, bobbed hair; female). They wear blue FBI blazers and have standard-FBI-issue 10 Heckler & Koch MP-5 machine pistols in oversized shoulder rigs. Dave is in civilian clothes, and is not armed.
Yo, Dave the Computer Man! Actually escaped the office!
I'm doin' field upgrades. Gives 'em a chance to hose out my cage. He glances through the window at Colonel Lee.
(continuing)
Who's the fuckin' gargoyle?
Their Chief of Security, Colonel Lee. Sabatini makes the jerk-off sign with her hand.
"Chuckles," as we're inclined to call him. (yawns; flops in a chair)
Friggin' graveyard shift...
Love to know what dope made it the Bureau's job to give full-time protection to foreign consulates. (offers coffee to Dave)
Cup a mud?
Not if you made it. Why don't you get Sabatini to brew the java? She's the alleged chick.
Blow me.
Where's Carson?
On his way. Some creeps tried to rip off his Mustang last night. (beat; solemnly)
They cut the ragtop.
Motherfuckers... Dave takes three PCMCIA computer cards from his attachE c
(continuing)
Latest and greatest. Wireless network link-ups.
Whoa, slow down, I'm gonna pee.
Me, too.
Ingrates.
The van drives in the lane alongside the Mercedes.
HUMMING, Javal drives with one hand, while tapping with h other on the top of the radio-controlled remote box.

As they approach the light at Washington Blvd, just turni yellow, Javal's van gets in front of the Mercedes. Their lanes stop for the red light. A FRUIT VENDOR holdin bag of oranges walks from car to car. Javal slips the van into neutral and lets it roll back un his rear bumper taps gently against the Mercedes' front b

The Driver hits the HORN. The van doesn't move. The Drive glances in the rear-view: There's a Jeep Cherokee tight on his tail, and the BLACK in it is busy dealing with a carpool full of 8-year-old K The Driver looks at Mrs. Han, who's peering out the side window, fascinated by the African-American-themed storefr They're all festooned with Summit-related banners, and SH OWNERS are preparing for a community sidewalk bazaar. Sam, bored, stuffs several pieces of GUM into his mouth.
Javal flips the switch on his radio-controlled remote.
Under the Mercedes, the device Javal planted there begins emit thick, white CS TEAR GAS.
The GAS pours in through the ventilation system. Everyone inside starts coughing and choking uncontrollably. The Dr grabs his AMD-74 machine gun and pops the door locks.

The Driver, Mrs. Han, Joy, Sam and Lisa pile out of the c Jittering with excitement, fear and speed, Javal hops out his van, holding a Benelli M-1, a semi-automatic shotgun. He SHOOTS the Driver in the chest. The BLAST from the sho muzzle, however, is unlike anything we've ever seen befor is blindingly BRIGHT, even in broad daylight, belching a cluster of glowing, white-hot magnesium. The Driver flies back against the Mercedes, EMPTYING his machine gun into the air. The wound in his chest is full BURNING magnesium shrapnel.

The other drivers in the intersection see this and go completely nuts. Some duck for cover under their dashboar Others peel away. A few COLLIDE with oncoming traffic. The Carpool Lady in the Cherokee pushes the kids down on floor. The Fruit Vendor hides by rolling under a car. Sam and Joy are incapacitated by tear-gas coughing fits. Han stumbles toward them, trying to get them to run away. Javal PUNCHES her, knocking her down. He turns to Lisa, surprised to see her. Sweating, he poin the shotgun at her... almost pulls the trigger... then no Mrs. Han's expression of horror and thinks the better of He spots a MOTORIST in a Ford Escort, peering cautiously his dashboard to get a look at the action. Javal SHOOTS the Motorist through the windshield with ano bright, searing blast of magnesium. The Motorist and the entire front of his car burst into FLAMES. Mrs. Han is on her knees, sobbing. Javal grabs her by the and pulls her to the back of the van. He opens the doors.
You see that I'm serious in my intention, yes? (she nods)
If you cooperate, you and your children will be home for dinner tonight. He tightens his grip on her. She nods again, then looks a kids. Javal shoves her, Sam, Joy and Lisa into the van.

He grabs three pairs of handcuffs off a C-shaped bar weld both ends to the inside of the van. He handcuffs one of M Han's arms, passes the chain through the bar, then handcu the other. He does the same with Sam; then handcuffs one Joy's arms, passes the chain through and attaches the oth handcuff to Lisa. Javal hops in his seat and drives away on Washington.

Several people, including the Carpool Lady, rush over to Driver, who lies DEAD and SMOLDERING on the ground. His hand is halfway inside his bloody pants pocket, holdi small plastic card with the Consulate's phone number on i
Colonel Lee and a North Korean Army OFFICER come running ANOTHER OFFICER starts up a car in the back of the house.
Robbins and Sabatini see the commotion and go to investig Dave follows.
Ambassador Han runs out. He has a stricken look on his fa
(Korean; to Ambassador Han)
[You must stay here.] Ambassador Han nods. The FBI agents run up. To them:
Someone took my family! The agents look at each other -- holy shit! Colonel Lee's SCREECHES to a stop. Sabatini stands in front of it.
You got no jurisdiction outside this property! Colonel Lee shoves a big, ugly Tokorev 7.62x25mm-caliber pistol in her face as he's opening the car door.
(continuing)
Shit! (to Ambassador Han)
Yank his fuckin' leash!
My men are going! Colonel Lee jumps into the car and it screeches away, alm running Sabatini over.
(continuing; to Sabatini)
It's a white telephone van, driving west on Washington Boulevard. The agents rush back to their guardhouse. Dave's governme Dodge is blocking theirs.
Keys! Dave tosses them to Robbins. Sabatini shoves Dave into th back seat. He looks at her, dumbfounded.
You're ridin' shotgun.
Dave is thrown against the back of the seat by the ACCELE
Cherry?
Under the seat. Sabatini grabs the red flashing light, puts it on the das
Siren?
I don't know! I'm never in a fuckin' hurry..!
Just as they race out of Fremont Place past the guard gat Carson, in Miranda's Volvo, comes in on the other side.

Carson sees the agents in the Dodge and floors the Volvo. fishtails, making a U-turn. He straddles the lanes on Wilshire to pull up next to the All the cars in front of them swerve to clear out of the He rolls down his window. Sabatini shouts over to him:
Someone snatched Han's family! White phone van, westbound on Washington! Carson looks like he's been punched in the stomach.

Give me a secure radio! Sabatini takes a small two-way MOTOROLA RADIO out of her pocket and throws it through her window to Carson. Droppi in his lap, he punches the gas. Robbins floors Dave's pie shit Dodge, trying to keep up.

Diplomatic Liaison EARL WALTHER is using the reflection i office window to adjust his necktie. Walther is 30, good- looking, black; a GS lifer working his way up the ranks b virtue of his quiet competence. A CO-WORKER sticks his head into the office, then shields eyes from the sight of Walther's sharp new suit.
Someone's been to Nordstroms, big time.
Clothes make the man.
But does the man make enough for the clothes?
(smiles)
The man makes payments on his Visa. Walther's SECRETARY rushes in.
Mr. Walther... priority line!
(into phone)
This is Diplomatic Liaison Earl Walther... What's the nature of your emer -- (grimaces)
Aw, Jesus... not today... (beat)
I'll inform channels and get a copter in the air. For God's sake, keep it quiet. Do what you can, but don't endanger civilians or the family!
Carson drives with one hand, while holding the radio.
(into radio)
You bet -- nice and easy. Real easy, until he narrowly MISSES a bunch of cars when SCREECHING around a corner.
Walther presses the intercom button on the phone.
(into phone)
Get the Secretary of State on the horn. (listens)
I know he left already. I'm familiar with the concept of time zones. Find his ass.
Carson turns the frequency on his two-way.
(into radio)
Robbins, Sabatini... Chopper's on its way.
Driving skillfully, Carson edges past the North Koreans.
And then, Carson can't believe it: he spots Javal's van, couple blocks ahead, driving at normal speed.
(into radio)
Check it out! Ahead, on the right!
(thru radio)
Think it's them?
(into radio)
Yeah... but it seems too easy... I'll move up; he won't suspect a civilian car. Stay back, then get on his ass when I signal. We'll box him in. He looks over at Colonel Lee, whose car is pacing his.
(continuing; into radio)
If the Mod Squad gets in your way, don't be shy about getting 'em out.
(thru radio)
Copy that one.
Glaring, Colonel Lee looks over at the FBI cars as they p
Sabatini pulls out her machine pistol, and tosses the two to Dave. He looks scared, and carsick.
Don't puke... I hate when guys puke!
Carson tries to approach Javal without drawing his attent
He still drives at the same speed as the surrounding traf
As Carson nonchalantly passes, Javal NOTICES the governme issue two-way radio sitting on the seat of Carson's Volvo
grins... it's show-time. He STOMPS on the gas.
Pissed that he's been made, Carson speeds up.

Driving fast, Javal makes a hard right. As the van leans the turn, something rolls out from under a sheet of canva the floor -- the Governess' BODY, bloodied and grotesque the plastic tarp it's wrapped in. Joy starts SCREAMING, as does everyone else when they see Javal pulls out a Beretta Centurion 9mm pistol and FIRES deafening round through the roof of the van.
I need to concentrate!

During a lull in traffic, a WELL-DRESSED WOMAN jaywalks a the street. An LAPD black-and-white changes lanes and put its flashing lights. As two COPS write her a ticket... Around the corner TWO MEN make a quick exchange of money vial of crack.
The Cops do notice Javal speeding by, with Carson's Volvo FBI Dodge and Colonel Lee's car in hot pursuit. They shov ticket in the Well-Dressed Woman's hand and hop in their

Javal turns onto the side streets -- rows of run-down apartment buildings. He takes a circuitous route, gaining one-block lead on Carson and the others. Then, he makes a sudden turn into a one-way alley.

Javal hits a remote garage door opener. Ahead, rickety do on one of a line of detached garages facing the alley OPE Across from the garage, parked parallel against the back empty building, we notice a duplicate van. It's facing th same direction as Javal is driving. Javal slams on the brakes, stopping just past the garage, then quickly backs up into the garage.

As he pulls in, we catch GLIMPSES of the van slipping bac into a FIBERGLASS SUPERSTRUCTURE that fits tightly around rear two-thirds of it.
